item.title: 2009 Convergence: July 20-26, Pittsburgh
item.content_encoded: In the past, we've held festive gatherings far from industry and concrete: hundreds camped out in forests, underneath stars, beside lakes, rivers, streams, and creeks. Climbing bluffs overlooking rolling hills and vast plains, we fell in love, met allies, and experimented with the experience of freedom. To create the spaces where this could happen, we sought temporary escape from the cities that had in so many ways coerced and constrained our very existence. Some of us, however, felt limited by this flight. We dreamed of building an anarchist castle out of the derelict abandonment right under our enemies' noses. Hundreds would arrive to help us paint a masterpiece upon our canvas of rubble: workshops, meeting halls, libraries, performance spaces, gardens, and orchards would be constructed out of ruins and wreckage. We'd supply food, shelter, and so much more; like before, we would exchange stories, ideas, laughter, and dance moves with the maniac nomads, eloquent criminals, and dedicated rebels who descended upon our city for a week of chaos and feverish activity. The beauty of this dream was that at the end of it all, some of us could stay; for another week, a season, a year, or maybe even the rest of our lives. It never had to end. We held onto this plan in secret, believing it to be impossible. Our dream was fraught with complications and seemed doomed to fail. It remained a fantastical plot we lacked the daring to attempt. Until now. Save the date, July 20-26, Pittsburgh, PA, and stay tuned for more details.

wp_comment.wp_comment_content: cool. that's near where i am now, i hope its near me in june also

i'll be moving there at the end of july. if anyone needs a place to stay (i know this is way in advance) i'd be happy to have you and your friends, lovers, partners in crime. gathered.ghosts@gmail.com if anyone is interested. -danielle
The W. Michigananders will be their in full force.
anyone from florida going besides me?
i don't know anybody in FL that will be going. i'm from Atlanta. i want to go but would like to find more people to go with.
puertorican from Central Virginia goin up there con to' lo que hay

Will be there. Likely with partners and daughter in tow. Somebody get in touch with me about childcare(whos expected, whats needed, how i can help) and helping with set up if you pleeease.
emmagershwin@riseup.net

crossed my mind that i should leave my email address so attendees from my area could contact me. sanguine_gloom@yahoo.com
and i'm coming from central florida if that makes any difference to anyone -.-

im really excited to see the things that we will be able to accomplish as a group, especially in a city environment. This should be a very interesting and fun experience. Altough i do love being in nature, i think this might help to give us more chances to experience new things that only a city can hold. I am excited and i hope to see everyone i saw last year plus more.
P.S. all hail to the maximum ultraists. ;)
I know this is run by Crimethinc (far east) but really...its gets farther east every year!

Wow, I'd heard the rumors but after reading this I'm even more excited. I think the previous years in the woods will be good preparation for making sure a city-convergence doesn't just wind up like another NCOR, while the city will force us to be more creative than spending our days idling in the sun, going swimming and cavorting in the woods.
Will we still huddle around campfires late at night? Where/are we all going to sleep together? Can we interact with the city the same way we have interacted with the woods, and maintain that sense of unity and collectivity we have when we are isolated from the world? I'm thrilled we're discarding the easy answers and starting almost from scratch here.
I've already been stewing over some ideas for things I can bring would be unthinkable in previous years. This is going to be totally fucking insane, and I can't wait.

"P.S. all hail to the maximum ultraists. ;)"
this made me laugh for a good five minutes! hahaha good times. you'd think they would've found a more eco-friendly way to promote their messages. remember how much litter was all over the campground?! gah.
it is definitely going to be weird to interact in an urban setting, but exciting.

"The beauty of this dream was that at the end of it all, some of us could stay; for another week, a season, a year, or maybe even the rest of our lives. "
I was just considering the alternatives to spending another summer here (New Orleans) without air conditioning when this came up. I could definately make this a three or four month trip this time (as opposed to just a week, like last time).

Looking to maybe check this out finally. I don't really have a way to get there, but I like to meet new peeps, especially ones who won't steal stuff from me.
video2411@yahoo.com or through myspace http://www.myspace.com/lunarbluenightmare

if anyone around dayton, ohio would like to carpool, i'd be delighted. maybe we could also meet up to gather up some supplies to share with everyone (i always have a ton of craft supplies to share)
emmaanarchy@gmail.com

Hey I'm hoping to make it to this years convergence. I'll be traveling from WA state. If anyone has any sort of transportation I'd be glad to hear from them. Oh, altogether it would be me and maybe two others. Thanks in advance! -Anton Demosthenes.winkwink@gmail.com
My best friend and I will be there. Perhaps we will bring others. I am thrilled this is going to be held in our city; we've been waiting, searching, for something like this. The date is saved.

I really want to come, but I am on probation and will need permission to leave the state. I can get permission by just telling my probation officer that I'm going to visit friends in Pittsburgh. I'd rather not tell him that my reason for wanting to travel is for a Crimethinc convergence, heh. However, I don't have any friends in Pittsburg. So, is there anyone out there from Pittsburgh that wants to be my friend or "friend," whose name I can use for whom I'm visiting? Please?
My name is Megan and I'm your friend from Pittsburgh. If you need anything else, aporeticheretic@gmail.com

I'm Adam, and a resident of the Bloomfield neighborhood in the city. Pittsburgh has a pretty sizable and interesting anarchist population already considering the small size of the city with a couple of awesome groups and spots, so to say the least, I'm absolutely psyched that yinz are coming to the 'burgh... especially since I was planning on heading out and doing some traveling at the beginning of August. Talk about a phenomenal sendoff.
If anyone from outside the area need anything or has any questions about the city (lucrative dumpsters, anarchist sites, landmarks, squatting areas, places to stay), don't hesitate to contact me:
apperception@gmail.com
Let me know if your in Kansas City and would like to attend.

Anyone from the LA area traveling out to the Convergence?
I know it's a bit of a ways but a couple of friends and I are planning on making it out there from Los Angeles.
windchimehouse@gmail.com myspace.com/windchimehouse

Anyone from Western Canada up for a road trip?
barbecue@riseup.net

Me, my long-time man, and even longer-time best friend will all be shedding everything and Heading East. The 3 of us are determined to make this trip more purposeful than previous hobo-about adventures, so along with WWOOF and various infoshop visits/playing shows over the next 4-6 months, the 1st major stop is Convergence. We are all staying in our faithful van but would very much appreciate a place to park and perhaps to wash up and meet folks. We've been home-free/hosted the home-free and are very mindful of being respectful of spaec, not taking advantage or giving travelling persons a bad name, etc. If you're interested in hosting a3 nice anarcho-weirdbeards email me at orphanspace@hotmail.com. Also whatever you do is fine, but if it's an issue, none of us drink/smoke/anything else. Counting the days til July......xox
PS sorry about the typos, I'm in a dark club on a laptop the size of a toaster. Also, I can cook vegan like a mofo and we play music and do dishes with vigor.

hey everybody., my names sean and I am from the baltimore maryland area. Me and a friend are planning on riding our bikes up to Pittsburgh and are looking for a place to crash during the convergence. We will be respectful, will do chores/dishes ect. for a place to stay. If anyone can help us out my email is fightback412@live.com . Thanks so much

So everyone knows, the plan for this convergence is still--as at the previous ones--to have communal housing, so no one has to seek places to crash, and so everyone can be together and get to know each other better. More details with be released soon; for now, suffice it to say the plan that's being hammered out is really exciting.

To B. Traven: Hey-o. That does sound very exciting. My name is Daniel, and i'm hosting a workshop concerning communal home space at the FOR (Finding Our Roots) conference in Chicago in late April. I would love to bounce around some ideas with you and whoever else would like to be involved. You can contact me at: therogue27@yahoo.com . Also: If anyone would like to help with my workshop, it would be much appreciated. just throw me an email. I am also interested in helping to set up housing in Pittsburgh after the conference.
TheLeftFoot: good, because I just accidentally deleted 3 responses in my email. I am computarded, but this is not such a bad thing overall...
Sirkullay: lolwut? please email me. I am known for my computer literacy.

I'm coming from Portland OR. and I've got my eye out for a carpool if anyone else from this area is going. As a given, I'm more than happy to provide anything I can to help with the trip and would also like to meet people here of like mind in any case.
I'm coming from Eastern TN.Its going to be the first time i've hitchhiked or backpacked...any tips?Also,I could use a place to stay when i get there...
I'm so excited about more details. I cant wait anymore, and i think i might quite possibly explode with anticipation. This convergence is gonna be amazing.
Abunch of us from Columbus are coming down there
craxy: do you already have a ride share set up? Im going too. From East Side Columbus (Arawak City) Ohio.
